venue.name: Wild Rover Bar Boston - 1 Block from Faneuil Hall

item.description:
* This is a several groups' event - for planning purposes, please RSVP on solely one group's page that you'll be joining us. Many thanks! *

This will be our joint groups' last Meetup Friday night Mix & Mingle party at the Wild Rover as the venu will be hosting bands on Friday nights from now on. So join us for one last hurrah!

Where:
Come mingle with 200+ members at the Wild Rover (at the edge of Faneuil Hall) at 61 Chatham St. Boston, MA. You'll spot it at the corners of Commercial St & Chatham St, next to Hong Kong Restaurant. 

http://www.wildroverboston.com

What:
The $10 donation guarantees a fun night with our own awesome DJ, 1 complimentary drink, 2 bar areas, free appetizers, fun dance floor, etc.

There is also free KARAOKE on the first floor for us if you want to kick it karaoke style.

Yum! 
We have arranged an open buffet of apps/food from 7-9pm of the following: chicken + hot buffalo fingers, pizza, cheese quesadillas, vegetable trays with veggie dip, cheese and crackers, etc.

Now the best part!
Arrive between 7pm and 8pm and get 1 complimentary drink ticket good for any beer, wine, and lots of house liquor mixed drinks! (Made with "well liquor" rather than top shelf ingredients... nonetheless complimentary!) This drink ticket will expire at 8:15pm sharp, do enjoy it before then! Do remember to please tip your bartender on your free cocktail.

How:
RSVP as attending on any one of our groups - just on one group, please : ) When arriving at Wild Rover, head upstairs and step right in (as to avoid blocking the stairway or doorway), looking for our private party sign up and for Alex, who is in charge of donation collection.

Tell Alex your first name, the Meetup group you belong to, and pay with a $10 bill  (we'll have some change, but a $10 bill would be very helpful). The funds collected will fund administrative expenses for our meetups (i.e. name tags, markers, website maintenance for group's outside pages, event bites etc). We will be giving you a colored wrist band such that you can move through both upstairs and downstairs.

Some notes:
- Wild Rover charges a $10 cover for all patrons coming in after 9pm, so do come through before 9pm, such that you can save $10 by paying solely for the meetup donation to Alex with a free entry to Wild Rover.
- Sometimes, those that arrive after 7:30pm might not get in right away and in the past have had to wait a bit downstairs with the waitlist folks. This always happens so it's another reason to join us on the earlier side! : )
- Ladies, the last two times we ran the event we had a 2-3 gents per lady ratio due to bad weather. So although up to you, this event can also a great way to make some new gent friends.

Directions by T:
Either the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, the State Street stop on the Orange line, or the Government Center stop on the Green line will have you a 5-8 minute walk from Wild Rover.

Parking:
Street parking can be tough on a Friday evening, and taking the T is highly encouraged.

If limited to just driving, there is $7 Parking after 5pm/weekends at International Place Garage, at 1 International Place, Boston, MA 02110 (0.35 miles from Wild Rover). Enter at 55 Purchase St. You can print the coupon below to use (not valid during posted game events).

http://boston.centralparking.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking-Parking-Coupon.html

Other nearby parking: http://boston.centralparking.com/parking-near/Boston-60-State-Street.html

----------------------------------------------------------------

Meetup groups invited thus far:
1. Social Fun http://www.meetup.com/SocialFun

2. Girls just want to have FUN http://www.meetup.com/FUNgirls

3. Fun with Alcohol http://www.meetup.com/fun-with-alcohol/events/55264212

4. The New to Boston Meetup Group 20's - early 30's http://www.meetup.com/The-New-to-Boston-Meetup-Group

5. Awesome in Boston http://www.meetup.com/Awesome-In-Boston

6. Singles Geeks, Nerds, and Professionals http://www.meetup.com/Professional-Geeky-Singles/

7. Boston Volunteers - Boston's most popular volunteer meetup http://www.meetup.com/bigenoughtodeliver

8. Red Sox Natives http://www.meetup.com/natives

9. Boston Happy Hour http://www.meetup.com/nightlife-421

10. Boston Euro Social  http://www.meetup.com/euro-76

11. FACT:  Free and Cheap Things (Boston)  http://www.fact-boston.com

(Working on adding 1-2 more big groups!)

----------------------------------------------------------------

We usually have 220+ members at these Mix and Mingle parties. I hope you can all join us for this last blast at this location. It should be fun!

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn More: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Connect with us:
item.how_to_find_us: We'll have the whole 2nd floor of Wild Rover all to ourselves (to the left, as you walk in). Look on the name tags for Alex or Biagio at the top of the stairs.

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Last Mix & Mingle Friday (and Welcome Spring Party!)
